meta_data.title: Ain't No Fight Like a Church Fight 'Cause a Church Fight Makes You Feel Especially Like Crap
meta_data.subtitle: Galatians 5:13-15 Thanks to everyone who supports TMBH at  You're the reason we can all do this together!  Music by

transcription_data.text: I would wager that at some point you've been in the middle of a weird unhealthy gossip circle where everybody was talking about everybody else and jockeying for positions socially and maybe you aren't the one who started it but you got into it and then you were playing the game and then at some point it felt icky hopefully because you figured out it was icky but maybe because somebody had to tell you and that was a bad feeling. I've been a part of that. I've been a part of environments where stuff goes at the term that used to get used so often was a toxic things go toxic. But it happens at church and that's worse than when it happens on a baseball team or in a circle of friends. I think church is the most disheartening place where you have that gossip feeding frenzy like a bunch of piranhas with meat in the water. When it happens to church, just gross, oh it's disheartening. Sometimes I've no believe in on the outside looking in but nah I've been swept up in that stuff too. Heck I've probably stoked it imagining or crafting for myself and my brain righteous narratives about how I was protecting something good or doing something good. I mean we always find this sophisticated language to justify when we get caught up in this stuff or when we make this stuff happen. It's gross, it's destructive and the Bible doesn't like it. Jesus doesn't like it. The Bible's pretty dang overt about how that ain't it. This is not a mark of the values of the kingdom and yet the Bible is also delightfully unpalley Anish about stuff in terms of what you're going to get at church and how people are. I think it's my buddy Jeff who's going to edit this. Jeff has said before that sometimes people say the church is full of hypocrites and his answer is yes and we have room for one more. I mean he's not being flipped in there. It's kind of in keeping with the teaching of scriptures with the teaching of Jesus that yeah there are these values of the kingdom and this is what we aspire to and when you have a transformed life that's how it should be and there's a whole lot of that that manifests in Christians but also the text is upfront about the reality that sometimes there's going to be stuff that goes way wrong for the church from without and there's going to be stuff that goes way wrong from the church from within. Now if you've ever been a part of that I mean it just feels awful. It leaves this weird hollow feeling in your stomach and you're like well is everything fake? I mean it can really mess with you when you go through something like that especially because normally you don't realize you're going through it until you're too far into it and then it's sort of this moment like the end of the usual suspects or whatever and you know the scales fall from your eyes then the rooster crows for the third time and you go what the heck? I was just a part of a stupid church thing. I can't believe I fell for that and then it feels icky and a lot of times churches will scatter and break up and all of that but it's really interesting that Jesus himself he doesn't use the word church very much but in the book of Matthew you know one of the five big speeches around which that book is built is the church discourse in Matthew 18 and a whole lot of that is dedicated to how to put it back together when things go wrong. What to do when somebody sins against you how to try to manage things so it doesn't spiral into weird gossipy stuff but what to do if it does and then just so that none of us would be under the illusion that Christians are just going to nail everything and there'll be no hypocrisy in church just so nobody starts to imagine that'll be the case really early on in the book of Acts. I mean you have amazing just win after win after win and then 3000 people signed up and then 4000 people signed up and the Holy Spirit did this miracle and then the Sanhedrin brought in Peter and they're like you gotta stop it and he was like should we obey you or obey God we're gonna obey God and like we're gonna flog you and then Peter's like all right and then it's flogged and he's like cool I got flogged. I mean it's just amazing stuff keeps happening and motives are right and spirits are high and then some people come in and they lie about supporting the church. They act like they're going all in like everybody else and sacrificing everything to be a part of the church but they didn't at all they wanted all the benefits but none of the sincere sacrifice and laying down their rights to serve you know their fellow members to their church and they die in church. So I mean the Bible again in the Gospels and then again in Acts is not shy about the fact that things will go wrong in church and then the letters my goodness have you read the New Testament the epistles that's a fancy word for the letters of the New Testament pretty much all of these are an open book acknowledgement that like hey just we're cool with those of you who aren't Christians reading all of this material but just so you know like we're putting it out there things go wrong sometimes in church and then we have to reorient ourselves to the truest realist thing to pull it back together sometimes it's pretty clunky I mean literally the entire book that we're working on right now Galatians is the Bible acknowledging that things can go sideways in church well they can go sideways a lot of different ways I mean false teaching Galatians deals with that I mean it comes up in most of the letters of the New Testament really pride comes up a lot also the stuff we've been talking about here gossip and slander and little factions and all of this I mean church I think is better than what I've seen in other environments I've been in but when it goes wrong it hurts worse than when it goes wrong at work or on the baseball team or at school or in a circle of friends or whatever because the expectations are higher you expect there to be some sort of group adherence to the principles and for people not to lose their minds at church but when they do you know yikes it's pretty screwed up in a whole book of Galatians Paul is unshy about acknowledging that factions have clearly happened here there is a fight going on and at times as I've been talking about it certain scenes I think it's kind of made sense characterize it to help you visualize it is you know you got Paul on the one side and you got the leaders the Judaizers on the other side and you got the poor innocent naive Galatians who don't know better and I think to some extent that's true but also I mean Paul's pretty hard on them at times like he says who has bewitched you but he is also like I'm bewildered by you how could you fall for this stuff so he's using both kinds of language people did something to you but also you guys are a problem you're not getting things right you're not following Jesus properly so much of the book of Galatians is just Paul breaking down the anatomy of how they're getting it wrong but when we get to Galatians 5 we discover the part of what Paul is calling out is the malice that is metastasized within the Galatian church itself it's not here's Paul's letter on one side and the religious leaders and pro circumcision crowd on the other side making their case and the poor naive confused huddled masses of the church like we just don't know what to do we're paralyzed we're frozen no the intonation from Paul is you have factions you have pride you have ownership of these mistakes I mean it's kind of a wild contrast god has on the one hand opened the eyes of the Galatian Christians to see him to understand the gospel to become aware of their sin through the power of the Holy Spirit through the presence of the law even god has done that but then on the other hand they also clearly still have the capacity to do stuff that is the opposite of God's will and the opposite of how God wants people to treat each other and the opposite of stuff that looks like the values of the kingdom and that emulates Christ so as we've been in Galatians 5 here understandably a lot of our conversation has been big picture theological stuff some of our conversation has been very practical stuff about like what Paul's trying to say and how he's trying to intervene but I want to just step back a little bit and look at these three verses we've been lingering on for a bit here and just see them as a critique from Paul he is saying you guys are fighting too much you guys are giving into gossips and faction and ick and you might feel like you can do that forever but you can't you will destroy each other you will destroy your church you will destroy this outpost of the larger Christian community if you keep doing this crap maybe I've read all these verses already I'm just going to read them again Galatians 513 you my brothers were called to be free but don't use your freedom to indulge this sinful nature rather serve one another in love okay we've interpreted that verse one of the two ways it needs to be interpreted so far and that is in light of circumcision and telling the truth to each other theologically and all of that but there's also pretty clearly a nod here that they haven't been serving one another in love they've been decidedly unloving toward each other or he wouldn't be saying this you guys I'm not telling you you have all this freedom so you can be awful to each other I'm telling you you have all this freedom don't indulge it for screwed up stuff instead use the liberty you have in Christ to serve one another proactively and lovingly the exact opposite of the way you guys have been behaving let's keep going verse 14 the entire law is summed up in a single command love your neighbor as yourself so Paul is pulling them back from the brink yeah there's a lot of theology and knowledge to talk about here and you might imagine that your theological rightness somehow gives you license to be awful to other Christians but it doesn't because the biggest most easy to understand simplest truth in all of this is the commandment Jesus affirmed as being the greatest one which is love the Lord to God with all you got and love your neighbor as yourself all the law and the prophets are summed up in these verse 15 if you keep on biting and devouring each other watch out or you will be destroyed by each other that's a powerful line and there'd be no reason for Paul to say that if the Galatians were the huddled masses confused as their two sets of spiritual parents are bickering no Paul views the Galatians as a belligerent in this fight he views them as having ownership here yeah God opened their eyes to see and to understand as God does for anybody but also they chose sin they chose to be unloving to their brothers and sisters unloving how will by indulging in falsehood a false gospel by being disobedient to the commands of Christ and by being cruel mean and gossipy to each other just another page over here and maybe the most famous part of the entire book at the end of chapter five we're going to get the fruit of the spirit if you go and look at that you'll notice that a whole lot of what Paul says is the fruit of the spirit it's all fruit that is relational in nature getting things right with other people getting things right with other people at church so Paul apparently he thinks that these Galatians imagine that they can just do this ad infinitum forever and ever and ever to each other that they can keep taking chunks out of each other's hide that they can keep saying horrible things that they can keep probably I mean you've been in fights you've been in gossip fights right what happens you leverage people against other people you don't give the benefit of the doubt to things other people said and did you have lengthy conversations where you just I mean it feels like a burden you know yeah like it's a burden but deep down you just can't wait to catch up on what everybody else has heard when you get sucked into this vortex of sinful destructive gossip that's how it goes these guys were no doubt engaged in that kind of stuff and the illusion they're living under is that they can take those kind of bites those shots at each other infinitely and the status quo will hold Paul is saying it won't there is an end to this it can be too much and when it is too much you'll have nothing left you'll just wreck this beautiful thing that is supposed to be this outpost the city on a hill this light that can't be hidden you know out here in the middle of Galatia and you guys are about to run the whole thing into the ground to your own detriment and to the detriment of others I can tell right now this conversation that just this passage is taking us in a direction we don't normally go which is toward the what do we do with this now part but I mean look at what the text is saying this is timeless this is practical this is stuff that I think we're supposed to think about and I'm going to engage with that a little bit tomorrow so we're going to pick up where we left off tomorrow we're just going to round out the thoughts on the passage and then we're just going to think about just a little bit and thank you in advance for indulging me a little bit what do I do with this what do you do with this what do you do with her in church what do you do when something goes wrong what does forgiveness look like what does it look like to get it figured out and do it better yeah more on that tomorrow I'm Matt this is the 10 minute Bible Iowa podcast let's do this again soon

certain scenes I think it's kind of made sense characterize it to help you visualize it is
you know you got Paul on the one side and you got the leaders the Judaizers on the other side
and you got the poor innocent naive Galatians who don't know better and I think to some extent
that's true but also I mean Paul's pretty hard on them at times like he says who has bewitched you
but he is also like I'm bewildered by you how could you fall for this stuff so he's using both
kinds of language people did something to you but also you guys are a problem you're not getting

masses of the church like we just don't know what to do we're paralyzed we're frozen no the
intonation from Paul is you have factions you have pride you have ownership of these mistakes I mean
it's kind of a wild contrast god has on the one hand opened the eyes of the Galatian Christians
to see him to understand the gospel to become aware of their sin through the power of the Holy
Spirit through the presence of the law even god has done that but then on the other hand
they also clearly still have the capacity to do stuff that is the opposite of God's will and
the opposite of how God wants people to treat each other and the opposite of stuff that looks
like the values of the kingdom and that emulates Christ so as we've been in Galatians 5 here

conversation has been very practical stuff about like what Paul's trying to say and how he's trying
to intervene but I want to just step back a little bit and look at these three verses we've been

another in love okay we've interpreted that verse one of the two ways it needs to be interpreted
so far and that is in light of circumcision and telling the truth to each other theologically
and all of that but there's also pretty clearly a nod here that they haven't been serving one
another in love they've been decidedly unloving toward each other or he wouldn't be saying this
you guys I'm not telling you you have all this freedom so you can be awful to each other I'm
telling you you have all this freedom don't indulge it for screwed up stuff instead use the liberty
you have in Christ to serve one another proactively and lovingly the exact opposite of the way you
guys have been behaving let's keep going verse 14 the entire law is summed up in a single command
love your neighbor as yourself so Paul is pulling them back from the brink yeah there's a lot of
theology and knowledge to talk about here and you might imagine that your theological
rightness somehow gives you license to be awful to other Christians but it doesn't because the
biggest most easy to understand simplest truth in all of this is the commandment Jesus affirmed
as being the greatest one which is love the Lord to God with all you got and love your neighbor
as yourself all the law and the prophets are summed up in these verse 15 if you keep on biting

and there'd be no reason for Paul to say that if the Galatians were the huddled masses confused
as their two sets of spiritual parents are bickering no Paul views the Galatians as a belligerent in

understand as God does for anybody but also they chose sin they chose to be unloving to their

here and maybe the most famous part of the entire book at the end of chapter five we're

lot of what Paul says is the fruit of the spirit it's all fruit that is relational in nature getting
